Slepe (pronounced "sleep") is a small coastal town which occupies an area east of Meiyerditch and Darkmeyer. The town is home to the sleeper plague, which causes infected people to fall into a deep eternal sleep, giving the town its name.

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Getting there
  • 3 Places of interest
    • 3.1 Church
    • 3.2 Port
    • 3.3 Bar
    • 3.4 Sisterhood Sanctuary
    • 3.5 Manor
  • 4 Monsters
  • 5 Gallery
  • 6 Trivia

History[edit | edit source]

The town was originally founded by Lady Phosani and her band of former Saradominist Justiciars who abandoned Saradomin's cause following Lowerniel Drakan's conquest of the area then known as Hallowvale. Phosani and the others offered their troops and the townspeople as tithes and sacrifices to Lowerniel, who accepted their offer. In return, he allowed them the land east of Darkmeyer. Phosani and the others created a small hermitage and grew a Zamorakian sisterhood, attracting more like-minded human followers in the process.

Due to the town's fealty to Lowerniel, Slepe is the only human settlement in Morytania whose inhabitants voluntarily allow their blood to be tithed.

Eventually, Otrava discovered the Elixir of Everlasting, a potion said to extend the lifespan of those who drank it. Phosani and the others, who wished to live as long as their vampyre overlords, drank the potion, unaware of its deadly side effect at the time. With this potion, the members of the Sisterhood oversaw the construction of an underground sanctuary due to their revitalized youth.

The deadly side effect of the potion kicked in sometime afterwards. Seeing the danger the potion caused, the inhabitants of Slepe moved the afflicted to the sanctuary and locked them inside for their own safety. The town, called Sleep at the time, was soon changed to Slepe in an unknown incident. The locals dubbed the disease as the Sleeper Plague, but due to the precautions set in place by Phosani, there appeared to be no further incidents until Year 169 of the Fifth Age, when the Sleeper Plague was recreated by the vampyre Kroy and his master Damien Leucurte to gather more blood to meet the nobility's demand for blood. The locals blamed it on the Painted One, who was actually a traveler from Varlamore, and killed him in the mistaken belief that it would end the plague. Kroy and Damien were killed at the same time, which ended further infections.

However, more than enough damage had been done, as the locals were unable to cure those afflicted, and in addition to this, a malevolent entity broke into the underground sanctuary to feast on those afflicted by the Sleeper Plague.

Getting there[edit | edit source]

The quickest methods of reaching Slepe are as follows:

  • Teleporting to Slepe via Drakan's medallion after using a Slepey tablet on it.
  • Teleporting to Ver Sinhaza via Drakan's medallion, then running north. Once players pass the small dock, run east to arrive at Slepe.
  • Using the Ectophial to teleport to the Ectofuntus, then heading north to the small dock and paying Andras 10,000 coins to row to Slepe. The player will arrive at a dock just south-west of Slepe.
  • Teleporting to Darkmeyer via Drakan's medallion, then use the shortcut on the eastern wall of Darkmeyer.
  • Teleport to Burgh de Rott with the Morytania legs 3 or 4 or to the Shades of Mort'ton minigame teleport after completing the Shades of Mort'ton quest which has a 20 minute cooldown then go south to Burgh de Rott. Go to the southern shore and use the boat to go to Meiyerditch. Traverse the wall obstacles, run east along the shore and then enter Ver Sinhaza. Go north through the opening in the wall to arrive at Slepe.
    • After completion of Sins of the Father, the boat south of Burgh de Rott goes directly to Slepe and the Icyene Graveyard.

Places of interest[edit | edit source]

Church[edit | edit source]

The town's church is Zamorakian, and currently houses Nemishka and Lady Crombwick, who both are infected with the sleeper plague and are under the care of Sister Sevi and Sister Toen, respectively.

On the 2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US], players can take a book named explosive discovery. A chest is also found here, but can only be opened with the old key.

On the church's roof, several chaos druids and chaos druid warriors can be found.

Port[edit | edit source]

Players can travel between Port Phasmatys (just outside the town, north of the Ectofuntus) and the small port south-west of Slepe. Andras charges players 10,000 coins if they are travelling to Slepe from Port Phasmatys, but will not charge them if they are travelling to Port Phasmatys from Slepe. After the completion of Sins of the Father, players may board a boat to travel between Slepe, Burgh de Rott and the Icyene Graveyard.

Bar[edit | edit source]

The Rat & Bat is a small pub run by Carl. He only sells bloody bracers to players, which, according to Carl, are made with local ingredients.

Sisterhood Sanctuary[edit | edit source]

Under the town is the Sisterhood Sanctuary, accessible by climbing down the stairs in the small house next to the church.

Manor[edit | edit source]

The Crombwick Manor is the residence of Lord Crombwick. As the entrances to the manor are locked, it is only accessible via the ladder in Kroy's laboratory in the Sisterhood Sanctuary. It has been invaded by Damien Leucurte, vampyre juveniles and vyrewatch, and as a result appears messy.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Chaos druid (level 13)
  • Chaos druid warrior (level 37)
  • Vampyre Juvenile (level 45)
  • Swamp Crab (level 55)
  • Vyrewatch (level 105)

Gallery[edit | edit source]

  • The Zamorakian church in Slepe.

  • The church's interior, adorned with Zamorakian imagery.

  • The Crombwick Manor.

  • The Rat & Bat.

  • The upper level of the Rat & Bat.

The basement of the house directly west of the Sisterhood Sanctuary entrance.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The basement of the house directly west of the Sisterhood Sanctuary entrance (with the icon) is a replication of the Forman Basement from the FOX comedy That '70s Show.
The grave in memoriam of British game critic TotalBiscuit.
  • With the release of the Theatre of Blood on 7 June 2018, a grave was added just north-west of the Crombwick Manor in memory of TotalBiscuit, a British game critic on YouTube. The grave's examine reads He was always there to ask and answer one simple question., which is the opening statement of his video series "WTF is (name of game)", in which he explains and reviews certain video games.
  • Slepe is the medieval name for St Ives, a market town near Cambridge (where Jagex is based).
  • The two Bowl of water spawns found in Slepe were added during the Theatre of Blood Design Stream when one of the viewers suggested adding a toilet to a house.

'''Slepe''' (pronounced "sleep") is a small coastal town which occupies an area east of [[Meiyerditch]] and [[Darkmeyer]]. The town is home to the sleeper plague, which causes infected people to fall into a deep eternal sleep, giving the town its name.

==History==
The town was originally founded by Lady [[Phosani]] and her band of former Saradominist [[Justiciar]]s who abandoned [[Saradomin]]'s cause following [[Lowerniel Drakan]]'s conquest of the area then known as Hallowvale. Phosani and the others offered their troops and the townspeople as tithes and sacrifices to Lowerniel, who accepted their offer. In return, he allowed them the land east of [[Darkmeyer]]. Phosani and the others created a small hermitage and grew a Zamorakian sisterhood, attracting more like-minded human followers in the process.

Due to the town's fealty to Lowerniel, Slepe is the only human settlement in Morytania whose inhabitants voluntarily allow their blood to be tithed.

Eventually, [[Otrava]] discovered the Elixir of Everlasting, a potion said to extend the lifespan of those who drank it. Phosani and the others, who wished to live as long as their vampyre overlords, drank the potion, unaware of its deadly side effect at the time. With this potion, the members of the Sisterhood oversaw the construction of an [[Sisterhood Sanctuary|underground sanctuary]] due to their revitalized youth.

The deadly side effect of the potion kicked in sometime afterwards. Seeing the danger the potion caused, the inhabitants of Slepe moved the afflicted to the sanctuary and locked them inside for their own safety. The town, called Sleep at the time, was soon changed to Slepe in an unknown incident. The locals dubbed the disease as the Sleeper Plague, but due to the precautions set in place by Phosani, there appeared to be no further incidents until Year 169 of the [[Fifth Age]], when the Sleeper Plague was recreated by the vampyre [[Kroy]] and his master [[Damien Leucurte]] to gather more blood to meet the nobility's demand for blood. The locals blamed it on the [[Painted One]], who was actually a traveler from [[Varlamore]], and killed him in the mistaken belief that it would end the plague. Kroy and Damien were killed at the same time, which ended further infections.

However, more than enough damage had been done, as the locals were unable to cure those afflicted, and in addition to this, [[The Nightmare|a malevolent entity]] broke into the underground sanctuary to feast on those afflicted by the Sleeper Plague.

==Getting there==
The quickest methods of reaching Slepe are as follows:
* Teleporting to Slepe via [[Drakan's medallion]] after using a [[Slepey tablet]] on it.
*Teleporting to [[Ver Sinhaza]] via [[Drakan's medallion]], then running north. Once players pass the small dock, run east to arrive at Slepe.
* Using the [[Ectophial]] to teleport to the [[Ectofuntus]], then heading north to the small dock and paying [[Andras]] 10,000 coins to row to Slepe. The player will arrive at a dock just south-west of Slepe.
* Teleporting to [[Darkmeyer]] via [[Drakan's medallion]], then use the shortcut on the eastern wall of [[Darkmeyer]].
* Teleport to [[Burgh de Rott]] with the [[Morytania legs 3]] or [[Morytania legs 4|4]] or to the [[Shades of Mort'ton (minigame)|Shades of Mort'ton]] [[minigame teleport]] after completing the [[Shades of Mort'ton]] [[quest]] which has a 20 minute cooldown then go south to Burgh de Rott. Go to the southern shore and use the boat to go to [[Meiyerditch]]. Traverse the wall obstacles, run east along the shore and then enter Ver Sinhaza. Go north through the opening in the wall to arrive at Slepe.
**After completion of [[Sins of the Father]], the boat south of Burgh de Rott goes directly to Slepe and the [[Icyene Graveyard]].

==Places of interest==
===Church===
The town's church is Zamorakian, and currently houses [[Nemishka]] and [[Lady Crombwick]], who both are infected with the sleeper plague and are under the care of [[Sister Sevi]] and [[Sister Toen]], respectively.

On the {{FloorNumber|uk=2}}, players can take a book named [[explosive discovery]]. A chest is also found here, but can only be opened with the [[old key]].

On the church's roof, several [[chaos druid]]s and [[chaos druid warrior]]s can be found.

===Port===
Players can travel between [[Port Phasmatys]] (just outside the town, north of the [[Ectofuntus]]) and the small port south-west of Slepe. [[Andras]] charges players 10,000 coins if they are travelling to Slepe from Port Phasmatys, but will not charge them if they are travelling to Port Phasmatys from Slepe. After the completion of [[Sins of the Father]], players may board a boat to travel between Slepe, [[Burgh de Rott]] and the [[Icyene Graveyard]].

===Bar===
The [[Rat & Bat]] is a small pub run by [[Carl]]. He only sells [[bloody bracer]]s to players, which, according to Carl, are made with local ingredients.

===Sisterhood Sanctuary===
Under the town is the [[Sisterhood Sanctuary]], accessible by climbing down the stairs in the small house next to the church.

===Manor===
The [[Crombwick Manor]] is the residence of [[Lord Crombwick]]. As the entrances to the manor are locked, it is only accessible via the ladder in [[Kroy]]'s laboratory in the [[Sisterhood Sanctuary]]. It has been invaded by [[Damien Leucurte]], [[vampyre juvenile]]s and [[vyrewatch]], and as a result appears messy.

==Monsters==
*[[Chaos druid]] (level 13)
*[[Chaos druid warrior]] (level 37)
*[[Vampyre Juvenile]] (level 45)
*[[Swamp Crab]] (level 55)
*[[Vyrewatch]] (level 105)

[[File:Slepe house basement.png|thumb|220px|The basement of the house directly west of the Sisterhood Sanctuary entrance.]]
==Trivia==
*The basement of the house directly west of the [[Sisterhood Sanctuary]] entrance (with the [[File:Cooking range icon.png]] icon) is a replication of the Forman Basement from the FOX comedy ''{{wp|That '70s Show}}''.
[[File:Slepe_TotalBiscuit_grave.png|thumb|220px|The grave in memoriam of British game critic TotalBiscuit.]]
*With the release of the [[Theatre of Blood]] on [[7 June]] [[2018]], a grave was added just north-west of the [[Crombwick Manor]] in memory of {{wp|TotalBiscuit}}, a British game critic on YouTube. The grave's examine reads ''He was always there to ask and answer one simple question.'', which is the opening statement of his video series "WTF is (''name of game'')", in which he explains and reviews certain video games.
*Slepe is the medieval name for {{wp|St Ives, Cambridgeshire|St Ives}}, a market town near Cambridge (where Jagex is based).
*The two [[Bowl of water]] spawns found in Slepe were added during the [https://youtu.be/8idFQzkb11s?t=3706 Theatre of Blood Design Stream] when one of the viewers suggested adding a toilet to a house.
